• Air under pressure is ejected from main nozzles and subnozzles at different pressures
• Different weft carrying forces are achieved by varying air pressure or ejection time
• The invention prevents wasteful consumption of pressurized air and ensures stable weft insertion
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving bast fibres and blended spinning with other fibres.
* The process includes steps such as health preserving the fibres, opening, cleaning, and carding them, and spinning them into yarn, with specific temperature, humidity, and duration requirements.
* Various experiments were conducted with different types of fibres and blends, showing a reduction in end breakage rate and improved flexibility and spinnability of the yarn. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, particularly papermaking, and provides methods and apparatus for measuring and removing rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of covered rolls.
* The invention involves strategically placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to measure pressure, calculate average pressure readings, and create a more accurate nip pressure profile by compensating for rotational variability.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a combination electrical cord support and holder for an ironing board.
* The apparatus includes a clamp for securing to the ironing board, a flexible cord support, and a detachable article holder.
* The cord support has a flexible mast with a foot for pivotable movement and a locking tab for securing in a raised position.
* The detachable article holder has a lower circular hoop, support bars, and an upper hoop with tangs for mounting to the clamp. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention relates to buttonhole controlling devices for sewing machines
• Different materials may cause buttonholes to not close or overlap
• Device includes foot pad, travelling assembly, and adjustable stop
• Travelling assembly moves with work fed during sewing of buttonhole
• Operator can adjust stop to define closure point of buttonhole
• Device ensures neat buttonholes regardless of material being sewn
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid solution.
* The apparatus includes a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch for spreading out the textile web.
* The spread-out textile web is treated with liquid, allowing for improved washing or rinsing without stacking the fabric.
* Different embodiments of the apparatus are described, including one with an air pass for the dwell stretch and another with a sieve drum for guiding the textile web in a meander path.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air flow system for a dry cleaner that brings in ambient air through the access opening without exhausting solvent vapors from the tubs.
• The machine includes a solvent flow system, an air flow system, solvent vapor handling system, and a refrigeration system to efficiently clean and dry clothes while minimizing solvent loss.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention involves a method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments using a quench chamber and a two-dimensional slot across the machine width.
* The system allows for easy adjustment of filament denier by changing the slot opening size and air flow rate, resulting in improved web formation control.
* The method and apparatus are flexible and can accommodate a wide variety of materials and operating conditions, providing advantages in terms of energy consumption, web uniformity, and process control.
</summary>

<summary>
• The fourth embodiment of the sewing machine includes a receiver 96 in addition to receivers 94 and 95.
• The ultrasonic pen 92 does not have an electromagnetic wave output circuit, and the sewing machine detects the ultrasonic wave using the receivers.
• The specified position is calculated based on the detection timings of the receivers, without acquiring the transmission timing of the ultrasonic wave.
• Formulas are used to calculate the specified coordinates E based on the distances between the specified position and the receivers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by applying functional additives.
* The preparations include ultrafine wool powder or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives like UV protection and anti-bacterial properties.
* Methods for preparing the preparations involve pulverizing wool or bamboo fibers into ultrafine powder and applying them onto fabric materials.
* The treated fabrics show improved properties such as ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle recovery, as well as enhanced anti-bacterial effects.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is an automatic quilting machine with separate computers controlling sewing machine functions and frame table movements, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function.
• The system includes a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, simplifying the process of sewing intricate designs into large fabrics such as bedspreads or quilts.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention relates to a method of making a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image.
* Conventional textile fabric production involves multiple steps, while nonwoven fabrics are more efficient.
* Nonwoven fabrics are used in various applications but may lack certain properties compared to traditional textiles.
* Support layers or scrims are used to reinforce nonwoven fabrics and improve physical properties.
* Hydroentanglement techniques can impart images or patterns to nonwoven fabrics.
* The method involves providing precursor webs with different fibrous matrices and a support layer, then hydroentangling them on an imaging surface.
* The fabric can have different properties on each side, with a fiber distribution control layer in between.
* The method can include pre-entangling, imaging, and post-entanglement treatments for durability and performance.
* The resulting fabric can be used in various applications, including hygiene products, medical supplies, cleaning wipes, and protective covers.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and insensitivity to disturbances.
* The device includes a stop in the feed path of the strip, controlled by a lever and air cylinder, which actuates the sewing machine's switching functions based on the position of the strip and stop.
* The device allows for precise positioning of the strip, automatic retraction of the stop, and seamless integration with the sewing machine's operation for efficient sewing of relatively stiff materials.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments.
* Traditional methods involve sewing the knit fabric together, leading to increased thickness and decreased productivity.
* The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped knit pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds.
* The end portions of the knit fabric are joined by overlaying loops and binding off gradually.
* The process is repeated until the two pieces are connected by the knitting machine.
* The method prevents the final end portion of the junction from loosening the stitch.
* The knitting machine used has multiple knitting needles on needle beds that can move back and forth.
* The method involves transferring loops between the moving and fixed needle beds to join the knit fabric.
* The end-to-end joined state of the knit fabric is shown in detailed diagrams.
* The method can be used in various garments and the transfers are controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, made of stranded cables sheathed in a thermoplastic material.
• The production line includes a reel for unwinding cables, a device for orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, and a cutting device.
• The method involves degreasing and preheating the cables before sheathing them in a thermoplastic material.
• The stranded cables are made of materials like steel, aramid, glass, ceramic, or carbon fibers.
• The production line allows for precise positioning of the cables in the jacket, ensuring high quality and flexibility in the traction element. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine.
• The rotary hook arrangement includes cams and a spring rod to control the rotation of the bobbin housing.
• A capsule release device is used to give the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation.
• The needle thread loop is guided around the bobbin housing without hindrance, resulting in smooth and low-friction motion.
• The use of the capsule release device reduces the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation.
• The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture.
</summary>

<summary>
• Liquid silanes are used in the production of silicon-based nanowires and films through electrospinning.
• Cyclohexasilane can be transformed into solid polydihydrosilane by thermal treatment or light activation.
• Electrospinning is a continuous nanofabrication technique capable of producing nanowires of various materials.
• Polyhydropolysilanes act as accelerants for the polymerization of cyclohexasilane.
• The inks can be used with various deposition techniques to produce composite materials.
• The inks can be used to produce electrically-conducting silicon composite electrodes for lithium-ion batteries.
• The produced nanowires can be coated with a conductive material for improved performance.
• The methods allow for the tailoring of chemical composition to achieve targeted conductivities.
• The resulting materials can be used in a variety of applications such as batteries, sensors, and photodetectors.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is directed to controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders.
* Existing creel arrangements automatically decrease braking force as spool wind diameter reduces.
* Prior art includes electromagnetic brakes and pneumatic biasing arrangements for thread brakes.
* The present invention allows for tension control for the entire array and individual spool holders.
* An arrangement with fluid pressure controllers coupled to spool holders and tensioning levers is provided.
* A biasing arrangement with piston/cylinder assembly influences tensioning lever for thread tension control.
* Tensioning lever subtends an angle of more than 45°, biasing arrangement subtends an angle of less than 45°.
* A brake shoe can be held by the tensioning lever for additional braking effect.
* Brake rotor can be a drum with a braking band or a disc with a magnetic system for braking.
* The biasing arrangements can globally alter thread tension and provide rapid braking when needed. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a sewing machine detector for detecting needle position and machine speed.
• The detector includes light shielding discs mounted on a shaft for accurate detection.
• Optical fiber supporters are used to minimize stress on the optical fibers.
• The detector includes reflecting portions for accurate signal detection.
• Power indication is done through an optical fiber cable to prevent interference with control circuitry.
• The detector is durable and compact, overcoming issues with vibration and wear.
• The design reduces the need for curved reflecting portions, making it cost-effective.
• The detector provides stable sewing machine operations by eliminating noise interference.
• The optical fibers are supported linearly to reduce stress and ensure accurate optical axes.
• The detector allows for simultaneous detection of multiple signals for sewing machine control. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a process for continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with high whiteness.
* Traditional spinning of viscose rayon involves complex treatments, but the invention simplifies the process.
* The process includes completion of coagulation, treatment with water of non-alkaline pH, and drying.
* The degree of white is measured using the Hunterlab apparatus by the Hunter method.
* The process results in a high degree of white yarn without the need for additional treatments.
* The process is carried out at spinning speeds not lower than 90 m/min and with specific water characteristics. 
</summary>

<summary>
• Continuation-in-part of patent application filed in 1984
• Issue with washing pulp after oxygen bleaching due to foam formation
• Various proposals for deaerating pulp before washing
• Description of a small deaeration tank for pulp treatment
• Tank design with inlet pipe, outlet, and swirl inducing inlet pipe
• Use of filtrate from washer as swirling fluid in the tank
• Diagram of oxygen reactor system and deaeration tank
• Tank dimensions and positioning of inlet and outlet pipes
• Example of tank dimensions for a 50 ton per day installation
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio.
* The function-oriented material design (FOMD) process is used to optimize composite materials for specific structural functions.
* The BTR composite structure includes tendon elements, stuffer members, joints, flesh, skin, and shell components.
* Various configurations of BTR composites, including two-dimensional and three-dimensional structures, can be fabricated using different materials and panel shapes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a load-limiting device for dissipating energy during a dynamic event in structures.
• The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads and can be easily replaced after deformation.
• The device is designed to prevent extensive damage to structures during seismic events.
• Different geometries of the device can be used for various bracing configurations in buildings.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet for flophouse facilities.
• The cabinet is designed to maximize space and provide comfort for users.
• The cabinet has an outer casing and inner casing for strength and functionality.
• Boxes for devices and shelves are integrated within the cabinet without protruding.
• Ventilation and sound-proofing features are incorporated for user comfort. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in the construction industry to provide a safe work area for workers at dangerous heights.
* The guard rail support includes rail supporting brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring, and can be used with overlapping wooden rails, short wooden stubs, or a mesh-like fence structure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods.
* The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery.
* Existing methods for oil recovery include electrical, heating, mechanical fracturing, and acoustic methods.
* The invention extends the range of acoustic stimulation using pulsed power sources to target specific scales of inclusions in the reservoir.
* Multiple sources in multiple wells can be used to stimulate oil production in a specific direction or volume of the reservoir.
* The invention includes methods for separating components of recovered fluids, such as hydrocarbons, gases, water, and impurities.
* Various separation techniques like membrane processes, fractionation, cryogenic separation, and solvent extraction can be used for separation.
* Recovery of heavy metals from recovered fluids can be achieved using specific methods like mixing with red mud or tar sand.
* The invention provides innovative tools and methods for enhanced oil recovery and separation of components from recovered fluids.
</summary>

<summary>
• The disclosure describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element in MSE structures.
• The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip.
• The splice is secured with connective devices and nuts to prevent lateral movement of the longitudinal wires.
• The composite soil reinforcing element created by the splice provides additional reinforcement to a vertical facing.
• Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to extend the length of a single soil reinforcing element.
• The disclosure allows for flexibility in designing and modifying processes for MSE structures. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a plow blade design with a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, allowing for efficient production and tailored fluid injection characteristics.
* Different embodiments of the plow blade include variations in the location of the fluid tube, leading edge sections, and nozzles, providing flexibility in controlling fluid flow rates and locations for specific job requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is an evolution of the MCL StuccoRite® Cavity Wall Cavity System.
* The system includes proprietary plaster, reinforced with pre-papered steel mesh, battens, and flashings.
* Movement control joints are provided for vertical and horizontal movement.
* Components and consumables include battens, mesh, sealant, and plaster.
* The system is designed for timber walls with specific spacing and moisture content requirements.
* Various uPVC mouldings are used for edges and corners.
* Reinforcement at corners and openings is provided with additional mesh.
* The system allows for the construction of decks and complies with NZS 3604 requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to safes adapted to contain valuable papers and articles.
* The safe structure includes grooves for receiving a steel door, lock assembly, and reinforcing bolts for security.
* The door is inserted at an angle and laterally displaced to lock in place, providing a secure closure.
* The safe can be constructed with a liner and concrete or as a preassembled steel safe, with variations possible for different applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a method for accurately measuring fluid pressures in geological formations at desired depths by isolating the pressure sensor in a borehole and creating a fluid connection to the formation pressure at the desired location.
* The method involves pumping fluid to clear the filter of grout, displacing the grout to form a communication path with the formation, and potentially fracturing the formation to allow formation fluid to flow to the pressure sensor for accurate pressure measurements.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member.
• The structure includes steps at the traveling path ends, elastic members mounted inside the steps, and a joint block across the expansion gap.
• The structure prevents tire fall-in/stuck-in situations, absorbs bridge girder expansion/contraction, and is easy to maintain.
• Different embodiments show variations in expansion gap configurations and the use of supporting blocks.
• The method of mounting the elastic member involves joining them, fixing them to the steps, and deforming them towards the bridge girder axis.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to floor track systems for transporting food stuffs in sanitary fluid treatment chambers.
• Traditional methods of cooling cooked meat products result in dehydration and slow heat transfer.
• Recent approaches use fluid treatment chambers with chilled brine solution for quick heat transfer.
• Overhead rail systems have limitations in fixed routes and contamination of solution.
• Wheeled hand trucks offer mobility but risk contamination of solution with unsanitary wheels.
• The invention aims to provide a floor transport system that prevents wheel contamination of treatment fluid.
• Two embodiments of the enclosed floor track system are described for different types of hand trucks.
• The system segregates the wheel structure from the treatment environment to maintain sanitary conditions.
• The system allows for the recovery and reuse of the brine solution, preserving resources and providing economic benefits.
• The invention offers a solution to prevent contamination of treatment fluid by hand truck wheels in fluid treatment chambers. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The lock device prevents a work machine of a construction machine from being tilted by its weight, specifically preventing a boom from rotating downward.
* The lock device includes an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket, an engaged member on the other, and a guide member to hold the engaging member in place.
* The lock plate can be easily operated manually, with features such as a hook part, slot, and guide members for stability.
* The lock device is designed to prevent damage and ensure smooth operation, making it suitable for various work machines like excavators, loaders, and cranes.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with an adjustable central vacuum portion for regulating suction efficiency.
• Prior art devices lacked the ability to regulate suction during cleaning operations, leading to the need for real-time adjustment.
• The apparatus includes adjustment mechanisms on the vacuum head for precise regulation of suction without adjusting the suction source.
• The device features inboard and outboard roller assemblies for adjusting the spacing between the suction head and the pool bottom.
• A kit form of the adjustment mechanism can be added to existing pool cleaning devices with minimal modifications, providing a cost-effective solution for regulating suction. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools.
* Wear bushings protect against excessive wear in casing heads and other well head elements.
* Existing methods involve using a retriever body with protruding dowels to engage a wear sleeve.
* A new apparatus allows for easy retrieval of wear bushings without the need for a drill bit.
* The apparatus includes a sub-unit with a mandrel, collars, and a retriever section.
* The retriever section is circular with protruding members for engaging wear bushings.
* Grooves on the mandrel allow the retriever section to move vertically but not rotate.
* The apparatus is threaded between two sections of drill pipe for retrieval of wear bushings.
* The retriever section can float vertically to prevent damage to the wear bushing.
* An alternative embodiment includes a retriever section with a threaded end for engaging threaded wear bushings. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Vibratory tool for downhole use with a passage for wireline or other tools
* Dump valve is annular to prevent slamming against a seat
* Modular stacked piston units increase power delivery
* Plug is dropped to initiate vibration operation
* Valve opens and closes without impacts
* Mandrel movement dissipates momentum after valve opens
* Tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle
* Valve design eliminates cyclical impacts and wear
* Components delivered within the body for longer trouble-free service
* Tool can be matched to power required for specific work string or conditions
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system for use alongside highways and railways.
* The system includes a face panel with integral counterforts and a precast base, allowing for taller walls and shorter bases.
* The connection between the face panel and base is made using rebar and grout, eliminating the need for temporary shoring during installation.
* Additional stability measures, such as H-piles or a vehicle impact barrier, can be incorporated into the design.
* The system is flexible, customizable, and cost-effective, providing a solution for retaining soil or other materials in various applications.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to systems and methods for delivering heat at the down hole end of oil or gas wells to improve production.
* Existing down hole heating systems have shortcomings in focusing heat and protecting electrical components from damage.
* The present invention addresses these shortcomings by focusing heat in the production zone and providing protection for electrical connections.
* The system includes a heating unit with electrical resistance heater rods, heat insulating packer, and stainless steel collars to contain heat in the desired zone.
* The electrical connections are shielded with high temperature cement and steel fitting assembly to prevent damage from down hole fluids.
* The method involves using the system to heat treat oil or gas wells for improved flow, with the option to use cable instead of pipe for supporting the heating unit during maintenance. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that may be stuck or lost within a well bore.
• The mechanism includes a latching mechanism for controlling the connection and disconnection of a pull tool to the object to be removed from the well bore.
• The mechanism can be used for wire line operations and includes features for easily latching and unlatching the pull tool from the object.
• The mechanism can be used for various down hole service operations, such as fishing operations, and can be replaced with a heavier duty tool if needed.
</summary>

<summary>
• Example embodiment relates to modular composed stave floors
• Drawbacks of conventional stave floors include thin sight substrate thickness
• Thin sight substrate leads to deformation and detachment during maintenance
• Conventional floors have short lifespan and poor resistance to scratches
• Example embodiment method involves providing thicker sight and base substrates
• Multidirectional holding means like dendrites and clamps prevent displacement
• Glue and reinforcement means used to bond base and sight substrates
• Improved floors have longer lifespan and allow for corrective maintenance
• Applied glaze from supplier enhances durability and aesthetic appearance
• Example embodiment provides increased durability and improved physical properties for composed stave floors
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to ladder attachments for stability, preventing damage to work surfaces, and preventing slipping.
• Ladders are used for reaching high places, but can be unstable and damage work surfaces.
• The ladder attachments increase contact area with work surfaces and prevent defacing.
• The attachments improve lateral stability and allow ladders to straddle corners.
• The attachments include a brace with a flange, U-bolt, and resilient pad assembly.
• Different embodiments of the attachments are described for various ladder types and situations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool.
* The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation during driving.
* The plastic material is an adhesive polymer, such as a blend of polypropylene and a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene.
* The connecting portion of the collation system includes a bridge and a rib, providing rigidity to the strip.
* Various configurations, such as notches, tapered elements, embossed patterns, and eccentric nail placements, are used to influence separation of the connecting portions at desired locations.
* The collation system is designed to minimize debris, increase withdrawal strength, and enhance penetration into the substrate. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Nozzle for applying sealants in multiple artifacts or machines
* Useful in aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics industries
* Bell-shaped tip and injection button for precise sealant application
* Overcomes drawbacks of current nozzles in the market
* Injection button with channels and orifices for accurate sealing operations
* Can be used manually or with automated sealant injection machines
* Made of plastic, preferably polypropylene
* Provides a strong but non-permanent connection between bell-shaped tip and injection button
* Allows encapsulation of rivets or nuts with sealant
* Simplifies sealing work, reduces application time, and increases quality of sealant application
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to position and motion sensors for monitoring moving objects in mechanical systems.
• The sensor system allows for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy consumption.
• The sensor includes a waveform generator and error correction generator to modify sensing signals and eliminate unwanted static signals and errors.
• A window reference circuit constantly compares the sensor output to a desired value and adjusts it if necessary.
• The sensor system minimizes power consumption by calibrating itself upon startup and recalibrating as needed.
• The sensor modulates current across two wires connected to a monitoring system, converting it into a voltage signal for further processing.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for internal combustion engines in automobiles.
• The system eliminates the need for springs in valve actuation, allowing for higher engine speeds and efficiency.
• The system allows for infinitely variable valve displacement, controlled by a rotating cam and translating means.
• The system can control intake and exhaust valves separately or in unison, with precise timing and sequencing.
• Computer control can adjust valve opening percentages for optimal engine performance and fuel consumption.
• The system can be applied to engines with multiple valves per cylinder, with each valve controlled independently.
• The system is robust, simple, and easily manufactured, offering significant performance improvements over traditional cam-spring systems.
• The invention provides a more efficient delivery of power for each gallon of gasoline, with precise, repeatable valve actuation for improved engine performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to aquarium lighting using LEDs.
* The light member includes a housing with a top and bottom side, a lighting control region with control channels for different colors of light, and switches for manual control.
* Modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light can be coupled to the lighting control region.
* The modules have a slim design with dimensions suitable for aquariums or other enclosures.
* In-line timers or remote control options are available for controlling the light output.
* The light members can also be used under cabinets with brackets for mounting and optional optics for adjusting the light angle or diffusion. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures.
* Current flow deflection apparatuses, like stator or rotor blades in gas turbines, use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures.
* The invention introduces separate inserts for separating walls in the cooling channels, replacing the need for cast walls.
* Advantages of using inserts include reduced material in transitional regions, no thermal stresses, and lower blade weight.
* Inserts can be made of metal or non-metal materials and can be easily adjusted for different applications.
* The flow deflection apparatus can be a blade in a gas turbine, with the inserts securely connected to the blade for high-speed rotation.
* The inserts are inserted through the blade root or tip and can be straight or U-shaped for deflection.
* The invention simplifies assembly, reduces thermal stresses, and allows for efficient cooling in high-temperature environments. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is a system and method for controlling the operation of a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control.
* The system includes a control unit that processes signals from the accelerator pedal and throttle valve to set the throttle position for optimal performance.
* The system can smoothly switch between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch forward or stall, providing full operation of the vehicle under manual control.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste.
• Conventional hog fuel burners are inefficient and emit high levels of pollution.
• The waste fuel burner described in the document emits minimal particulate materials and operates efficiently.
• The burner forms a conical pile of waste fuel with preheated underfire air percolating up through the pile.
• Volatile gases are partially oxidized in a primary combustion chamber with swirl air introduced tangentially.
• Secondary combustion air is introduced in a secondary chamber for complete combustion.
• The burner operates below stoichiometric proportions in the primary chamber and with only 20% excess air in the secondary chamber.
• The burner has fast response times to changes in load and burns wet wood effectively.
• The burner produces little slag or clinkers and can burn wood with nominal ash content.
• The burner can be adjusted to operate with a low or high volume of fuel, has infrequent cleaning needs, and can be used for various industrial purposes. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration in air conditioning, utilizing a heat exchanger to separate evaporating water from the cooling air stream for sensible cooling.
* The system efficiently cools air by recirculating return air from the load as working air on the wet side of the heat exchanger, achieving a high cooling capacity with low energy consumption compared to vapor compression refrigeration units.
</summary>

<summary>
* The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series for pumping fluids at high volumetric flow rate and high pressure.
* The pump heads have impellers driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads.
* The pump heads have combiners to combine fluid flow from multiple conduits into a single flow.
* The drive structure includes connectors to connect and drive the impellers in each pump head.
* The pump assembly can be mounted on support structures like a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer.
* The pump can be used for pumping liquid manure from reservoirs in agricultural operations.
* The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance by allowing for the addition of more pump heads in the series. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders
• Traditional engine brake systems have one brake per cylinder, leading to excess components
• The invention provides engine brakes for a portion of cylinders, reducing components
• The engine includes a high pressure pump, electronic control module, and cylinders with pistons
• Each cylinder has a fuel injector, exhaust valve, and some have engine brakes
• The engine brake system includes solenoids, valve members, and hydraulic components
• The engine brake is activated during the compression stroke of the piston
• The brake opens the exhaust valve to release compressed air during engine braking
• The modular design allows for customization of braking horsepower and cost savings
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox.
• Aircraft gas turbine auxiliary gearboxes are designed to withstand various loads, including extreme shocks from blade-off events.
• Conventional gearboxes are constructed to rigidly withstand all anticipated loads, often requiring additional material or being heavier.
• The link assembly includes a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the male and female links.
• The female link allows translation of the male link relative to it, forming a radial interface that dampens translation.
• The mounting link can absorb extreme shocks without detaching the gearbox from the engine.
• The pin serves as a fusible link that shears at a known load magnitude to prevent damage to components.
• The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy created by translation of the male link.
• The snap ring limits the relative travel of the male link within the female link to prevent separation after the pin is sheared.
• The use of the pin and coulomb damping eliminates the need for all linkages to survive extreme loads, reducing weight and maintenance requirements.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to apparatus and methods for attaching arrow points and nocks to arrow shafts and for balancing arrow shafts.
* The invention includes a point cap system for adjustable weight, a balance pin for balancing arrow shafts, and means to attach points without allowing dirt to enter the shaft.
* The invention also includes a point adaptor, a nock cap adaptor, and a balance pin for adjusting point weight and balance. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training.
• It utilizes an electrical ignition system and plastic expendable housing with pyrotechnic charges.
• The circuitry includes bolt and trigger interfaces, oscillators, firing counter, firing decoder, firing control, and firing sensors.
• The simulator is designed to provide realistic training with an actual weapon at a lower cost.
• The plastic expendable contains pyrotechnic charges sealed in cups, ignited by a bridge wire.
• The simulator is housed in a reusable housing resembling a magazine clip for an M16 rifle.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines.
• The device includes a tank, two pipes of different sizes, and a valve for engine performance improvement.
• The smaller pipe acts as a resonator to reduce intake noise.
• The valve operation is based on engine speed and load conditions for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a two-part bracket system that allows for easy mounting of speakers or other equipment on various surfaces, such as poles or walls, by one person.
• The bracket assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, with the adjustable bracket being attached to the object to be mounted and then positioned on the stationary bracket for installation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a burner for heat utilizing appliances, designed for efficient and clean burning.
* The burner includes a combustion chamber with a fuel holder, surrounded by an outer wall and a shroud for directing combustion air.
* Additional features include legs for support, a pivotally coupled ash pan, a cover for safety, and a grill for cooking.
* The burner can be coupled with modular heat utilizing appliances such as cookers, smokers, space heaters, and pyrolyzers.
* The system includes a pyrolyzer with a condenser for recovering liquid products of pyrolysis and a fuel feed feature for continuous operation.
</summary>

<summary>
* Rotary internal combustion engines require efficient cooling systems to improve fuel economy and durability.
* The cooling system in a rotary engine is crucial for preventing housing distortion and structural failures.
* Dual spark plugs are used in rotary engines to ensure complete combustion of the air-fuel mixture.
* In-line arrangement of spark plug bosses disrupts cooling flow and hinders heat extraction.
* Staggered arrangement of spark plug bosses improves coolant performance and prevents vapor collection.
* The offset positioning of spark plug terminals on the trochoid surface enhances heat transfer.
* Tests show that staggered spark plug configuration increases heat transfer coefficient by up to 44%.
* The offset of spark plug terminals should be less than the radius of the boss for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing.
• The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain total mass flow through parallel valves constant, minimizing steam boiler pressure changes and turbine power changes.
• The flow compensation is determined based on the difference in flow characteristics between N and N-1 turbine control valves.
• Test compensation circuits are used to adjust flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance during valve testing.
• The method and system were tested in a simulated turbine system, showing a 95% reduction in pressure excursion with the use of flow compensation. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a mixing valve for combining fluids from two separate sources into one mixture
• The valve allows for a range of mixture proportions from 0% to 100% of each fluid
• The valve is designed for use in aircraft cleaning apparatus
• The valve body has two inlets for soap solution and water, and one outlet for the mixture
• The valve includes a spool valve with adjustable settings for controlling the mixture ratio
• The valve system allows for continuous analog control of the mixture proportions
• The design of the valve ensures constant fluid pressures at the inlet passages
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.
* The method involves compressing gas to a higher pressure, cooling it, and then expanding it to the desired exit pressure.
* The arrangement includes compressors, heat exchangers, valve-controlled pipelines, and electronic controls.
* The method reduces investments and operational risks compared to conventional re-cooling plants. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Electronic components produce heat during operation
* Free convection cooling may not be sufficient in many applications
* Cooling fans are used to move air across electronic components
* Traditional fastening methods for mounting fans increase costs
* The system disclosed eliminates the need for traditional fasteners
* The system includes a motor, mounting legs, and spring members
* Installation involves compressive and rotating forces to secure the fan in place
</summary>

<summary>
* Spacecraft structures require lightweight composite materials, but lack inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that can compromise functionality.
* Conventional kinematic mounts have limited success in reducing vibration levels, prompting the need for novel damping features.
* The invention introduces damping mechanisms into kinematic mounts to dissipate vibration energy and protect instruments from flight loads.
* Two embodiments of the damper design are presented, utilizing spherical and cylindrical slot dampers to achieve significant levels of damping in the mount suspension modes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a clutch unit of the oil shear type for large power transmission requirements, such as in aircraft catapult systems.
* The clutch unit features interleaved clutch plates and discs, with separate piston and cylinder means for each disc segment to minimize residual drag.
* The unit includes a servo control valve, first and second stage fluid amplifiers, and a unique design for easy removal and replacement of clutch disc segments.
* The clutch unit provides improved cooling, torque control, and minimal disc friction, while also utilizing centrifugal force for disc retraction and reducing residual drag.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention describes a system of combustion and expansion cylinders in a cascading configuration to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction and reduce exhaust emissions.
• Water injection, water recovery systems, and catalytic materials are utilized to optimize the system's efficiency and reduce the need for a radiator.
• The system aims to capture a greater percentage of useful energy generated by combustion, resulting in higher thermal-to-mechanical efficiencies and reduced heat loss to the environment.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel for welding and heat treatment to obtain parts with good mechanical characteristics and corrosion resistance.
• The method involves removing the metal alloy layer from the periphery of the plate before welding to prevent the formation of intermetallic areas that reduce deformability.
• Different methods of removing the metal alloy layer, such as brushing or laser ablation, are described to ensure the removal is precise and effective.
• Welded blanks are then heat treated to form an intermetallic alloy compound for corrosion protection and to achieve desired mechanical properties.
• The method results in welded joints with no intermetallic areas, good ductility, and corrosion resistance, making it suitable for automotive safety parts. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a continuation of a patent application for a SCADA system for energy extracting vessel navigation.
* The invention optimizes energy recovery from severe weather patterns using a remote control system.
* It includes a central service facility for maintenance and energy storage.
* The system gathers data from GPS, weather satellites, and other sources for navigation and operation.
* The system uses algorithms to optimize efficiency and control mechanisms on the vessel.
* It allows for remote control of various mobile structures for energy extraction.
* The system includes electromechanical circuits for controlling mechanisms like rudders and sails.
* The GUI allows human operators to interact with the system, adjust settings, and choose navigation plans.
* The system accounts for weather patterns, physical object detection, and energy yield in navigation decisions.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from at least one ring element and guide structures for rolling bodies.
* The cage is made by joining flat material ring segments in succession and welding them together.
* This method reduces cutting waste and production costs for rolling body guide cages.
* The flat material ring segments are connected across engagement zones and welded along facing edge regions.
* The joint contours form an undercut geometry to couple the ring segments together.
* The ring segments are punched out from sheet metal material and formed as 120° segments.
* The method is suitable for radial and axial bearing cages, such as groove and angular ball bearings.
* The ring elements can be welded together in a rotary plate, with only three weld points needed for each ring element.
* Laser welding is preferred for forming the weld points, ensuring high-strength connections.
* The process allows for efficient production of rolling body guide cages with reduced material waste. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Methods and systems are provided for obtaining information related to a customer service location, including using global satellite positioning to obtain latitude and longitude coordinates.
* The system also includes a mapping system to provide driving directions for service technicians traveling between multiple customer service locations.
</summary>

<summary>
* System for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields with two sensors and a digital processor
* Feedback control systems used to compensate magnetic interfering fields
* Helmholtz coils used for generating homogeneous compensation fields
* Control system calculates control signals for devices generating magnetic fields
* Virtual sensor created by combining output signals of two real sensors
* Control loops operate in parallel to process virtual sensor signals
* Control signals generated for coils based on modified virtual sensor signals
* Feedback effects considered when using two compensation systems in close proximity
* Matrix calculations used to describe control algorithm for compensation system
* Experimental determination of feedback matrix elements for double installation of compensation systems
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy, where resonance sites are furnished by a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner.
* Bioorthogonal reactions are used to introduce resonance sites into the sample, allowing for improved visualization in CARS microscopy and selective detection of target sites without interfering with natural processes.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from different sources in radiation therapy.
* The system compares segmentations from different sources by converting them to volume models and identifying common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* Different measurement metrics can be assigned to specific structures for comparison.
* The comparison process involves voxelizing the segmentations, adjusting for origin offsets, and evaluating common, missing, and extra volume elements.
* The evaluation results are displayed in a graphical interface showing common, missing, and extra volume elements in different colors.
* Quantitative evaluation includes primary and secondary volumes, missing and extra volumes, and metric method/metric score.
* A histogram table tallies missing and extra volume elements based on distance measurements.
* The system can be used for training clinicians, quality assurance of auto-segmentation routines, and assessment of new treatment plans.
* The output of the system can help determine if a new treatment plan is needed based on changes in patient anatomy during radiation therapy.
</summary>

<summary>
* Accelerating the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
* Determining the difference between a subset of operand exponent arguments.
* Initiating subtraction of operand fractions based on subset difference.
* Reducing time to execute effective subtraction operation.
* Using techniques to accelerate computation of final fraction result.
* Implementing apparatus with detection, shift, selection, and subtraction units.
* Accelerating computation by calculating subset difference prior to complete operand argument difference.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a method of tracking specimens collected from patients in a medical facility.
• Mislabeling of specimen containers is a common problem in hospitals, leading to potential medical risks.
• The method involves storing machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, order forms, specimen containers, and specimen-taker badges.
• Unique barcode numbers are assigned to each patient, order, specimen container, and specimen-taker.
• The computer system tracks the relationship between these barcode numbers to ensure accurate specimen collection.
• The system generates alerts for out-of-date specimen containers and ensures timely specimen collection.
• The method eliminates the need for vial labels and reduces the risk of mislabeling errors in specimen collection.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device for golfers.
• The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition to provide distance and other information.
• It can be incorporated into headgear, such as a hat or visor.
• The device can also provide recommendations based on past performance and user input.
• Bluetooth technology may be used for data transfers and audio communication.
• Users can record geographic coordinates of golf courses using the device and share them with others.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to semiconductor design technology for implementing circuit designs into silicon-based integrated circuits.
* Design rule checks (DRC) are used to inspect mask pattern data for compliance with topological layout rules (TLR).
* Conventional methods for checking design rules in system-on-chip (SOC) designs often result in false errors and require manual filtering.
* The present invention provides a system and method for accurately detecting errors in logic and memory regions of an IC.
* Customized design rules are created by modifying standard logic rules to accommodate different memory regions.
* The system categorizes errors based on logic, different types of memory, and ROM groups.
* The invention improves the design verification process in the semiconductor industry and similar industries by applying the right set of rules to the right regions of the mask pattern data.
</summary>

<summary>
• Thin substrate waveguides can be used for controlled illumination of objects such as holograms and spatial light modulators.
• Waveguide holograms provide high diffraction efficiencies and eliminate stray light propagation.
• WGH illuminators occupy less space compared to conventional lens systems and have high spectral selectivity.
• Illumination depletion and two-sidedness are challenges that can be addressed through a priori or a posteriori compensation methods.
• Different recording configurations can be used to create WGH gratings for illuminators.
• The quality of reconstructed beams can be analyzed for polarization and phase characteristics, with potential for further improvements in efficiency and performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to testing squirrel cage rotors for induction motors to detect defects.
* The apparatus includes test heads with exciting means, voltage sensing means, current sensing means, and processing means.
* The method involves magnetizing the rotor, sensing induced voltages, and determining resistance, reactance, and effective skew.
* Statistical analysis is performed to compare test results and identify defective rotors. 
</summary>

<summary>
* Mobile devices can be secured by allowing managed libraries access to native resources based on digital certificates.
* Third party applications can be restricted from accessing native resources by denying access through managed libraries.
* An arbitration layer can be used to control access to native resources and ensure security.
* Managed applications can be verified for type-safe code and access permissions before execution.
* Digital signatures can be used to verify and authenticate executables stored in containers for distribution to mobile devices.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to an improved identification card with an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between protective layers.
* The card design protects electronic components from damage and bending stresses.
* The card is constructed using a core layer, bottom sheet, adhesive layers, polymer layers, image-receiving layers, and protective layers to create a durable and secure identification card.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to implementing a FIFO queue in a memory, specifically in functional memories.
* In a functional memory, updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating.
* A tree-shaped structure is used to implement the FIFO queue, with nodes having a maximum size.
* Additions are directed to non-full nodes on the edge of the tree, maintaining balance and fill conditions.
* Deletions are made in reverse order, always deleting the rightmost record.
* A header node is added in a preferred embodiment, containing pointers to the end, middle, and beginning of the queue.
* The header node improves efficiency by reducing copying and space requirements during updates.
* An inversion bit is added to the header node to indicate the direction of the queue.
* The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of the inversion bit.
* The memory arrangement includes a memory, intermediate registers, control logic, and input/output registers for managing the queue. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to embedded EPROM devices using existing IC technologies, such as using DRAM technology for EPROM redundancy circuits.
* The invention also introduces SEPROM devices, which utilize transistor properties changed under stress conditions to store data, providing a cost-effective and secure solution for embedded applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to determining the optimum value of feedback gain for feedback control.
• Feedback control involves detecting error, calculating correction amount, and correcting steering angle.
• Different systems like P, PI, PD, and PID are used for feedback control with different gains.
• The method involves provisionally determining feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting error, calculating evaluation value, and repeating the process.
• Evaluation values like LR, Svv, and Asv are used to determine the optimum values of P, I, and D gains.
• The method can be applied to automatic guidance vehicles running along a predetermined course.
• The second embodiment involves determining gains while the vehicle runs continuously along the course.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range.
• The zoom lens design focuses on achieving high relative aperture, reducing bulk and size, and preserving high-grade optical performance.
• Specific conditions and constructions for the fourth and fifth lens units are outlined to correct aberrations and achieve high optical performance.
• Four numerical examples of specific zoom lenses are provided, showcasing the application of the conditions and constructions for optimal performance.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles in a detector.
* The method involves discharging charge pulses on the low-voltage side of the detector.
* Individual signals are amplified in a fast amplifier, and signals are integrated in a slow amplifier.
* Signals are separated based on the rate by using capacitors and inductive elements.
* Amplifications in different amplifiers are performed at overlapping rates of signals.
* Detector material can be doped or coated with a converter material for detecting uncharged particles.
* Materials enabling fast charge transport at room temperature, like diamond, are used as detector materials.
* The method and device can be used in particle accelerators, reactor installations, diagnostic devices, and other applications.
</summary>

<summary>
• Invention relates to gauging fixtures for spin checking driven disc assemblies in friction clutches
• Clutches connect rotational power source to driven mechanism in vehicles
• Driven disc assembly must be within tight tolerances to prevent contact with pressure plate
• Prior test fixture manually checked warpage of driven disc assembly
• New apparatus automatically checks warpage and generates indication of good or bad assembly
• Apparatus includes torque motor, stationary and movable rings, position sensor, and servo motor
• Microprocessor controls operation of apparatus
• Program sequence includes engaging driven disc assembly, applying torque, and measuring warpage
• Apparatus provides external indication of whether driven disc assembly is within tolerances
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model.
• The invention addresses challenges in accurately estimating the age of faces.
• The invention can be beneficial for businesses, security technologies, and more.
• Face aging is influenced by various factors, making age estimation complex.
• Computer science approaches to face aging are relatively new.
• The invention involves extracting facial features and mapping them to age groups.
• Support Vector Regression and Support Vector Machines are used for classification.
• The invention includes a method for training and a method for face age-estimation.
• The computing system for implementing the methods includes various components. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images with different resolutions.
• The device consists of a matrix of pixels organized in arrangements of four pixels, with some pixels dedicated to each image.
• Different arrangements of pixels are described, allowing for the display of monochrome or two-color images.
• The controller of the device can apply attenuation functions to adjust the light intensity signals for optimal display.
• The device can display images from different sources, such as night vision sensors and infrared sensors, simultaneously.
• The device can combine multiple images, with each pixel dedicated to a specific image, allowing for efficient use of display space.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, with a payment element for cashless transactions.
• The payment element is removably fastened in a receptacle of the housing, allowing the user to remove it for payment actions.
• The closure on the housing protects the receptacle when the payment element is removed, ensuring no disruptions in communication with the security system.
• The payment element can communicate with a payment system, serving as a credit or debit card with a microprocessor and storage device.
• The closure can be a dummy plug or a cap, movably mounted on the housing to seal the receptacle and protect contact elements. 
</summary>

<summary>
• An imaging device becomes inactive when not in use and may enter a sleep mode to save energy.
• The tribo charge of toner in the device may decrease during long periods of inactivity, affecting image quality.
• Various embodiments provide methods for charging toner based on periods of inactivity to maintain image quality.
• An apparatus for charging toner in an imaging device may include sections for determining inactivity and charging toner.
• The user usage pattern may be determined to predict the next usage of the machine.
• A method for charging toner may involve measuring the toner charge level and adjusting it based on the difference from a predetermined level.
• The disclosed methods can be implemented in software or hardware to adjust the tribo charge of toner.
• The methods described can be combined into different systems or applications, with room for variations and improvements.
• Future modifications or improvements by those skilled in the art are also intended to be encompassed by the claims.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus with multiple MR heads and recording heads, controlled with high precision using a single control line.
• The apparatus allows for independent regulation of bias currents for MR heads and recording currents for recording heads, ensuring optimal operating points.
• Control data for head switching and current settings are given priority to prevent signal loss and ensure stable data recording and reproduction.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables.
* Two general techniques of locating buried metallic objects are passive and active.
* The invention provides a system and method for locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
* The system includes a transmitter with two antennae and a receiver that senses magnetic fields associated with the currents induced in the objects.
* Different techniques are employed to make the currents distinguishable and produce an output signal dependent on the presence of both currents.
* The invention improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing buried objects, especially in environments where the horizontal separation between objects is related to the depth of the object to be located. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network for hands-free automatic answering and communication.
• The apparatus includes a timer for controlling the length of time of the call and a bypass switch for extending the call duration.
• The system can be used in various settings such as hospitals, businesses, and homes.
• The electronic embodiment uses an optocoupler to automatically connect the speaker phone to the telephone lines.
• The electromechanical embodiment uses a neon lamp and photocell to trigger the connection between the speaker phone and telephone lines.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to optical fiber communications and network design.
* Optical fiber amplifiers have increased transmission capacities for digital data.
* The focus is on developing reliable undersea networks with multipoint connectivity.
* Trunk and branch structures enhance network survivability in case of cable cuts.
* The invention reduces the need for undersea repeaters by using remotely powered optical amplifiers.
* The system includes hub assemblies, branching units, branch fiber optic cables, and optical amplifiers.
* The network design allows for full connectivity, isolates cable station failures, and reduces costs. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is directed to cover plate devices for wiring devices in ganged boxes mounted in building walls, providing a finished look without exposed fasteners.
* The cover plate device consists of an attachment member and a cover plate member, with latching pawls and saw-tooth shaped racks for easy installation and removal, accommodating variations in wall contour.
</summary>

<summary>
* The present invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, consisting of concentrically nested annular strips that can be fixed in front of a displaying screen and slide over one another between a pushed-in and pushed-out position.
* The strips have decreasing wall thickness in the axial direction, allowing for different angular positions relative to the screen, providing flexibility in viewing angles. The device can be easily attached to a monitor using an adapter member, providing a flat attachment face.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to automatically informing a speaker to decrease their speaking rate when it exceeds a rate that a listener can comprehend.
* The method involves detecting the language being spoken, determining the listener's proficiency, setting a speaking rate threshold, and notifying the speaker to slow down if necessary.
* A wearable device with a microphone, sensory mechanism, and processing components can be used to monitor and adjust the speaking rate during a discourse.
* The device can also utilize network connectivity to exchange digital content and perform speech processing operations remotely.
* The method aims to improve comprehension by adjusting the speaking rate based on the listener's language proficiency and speech clarity. 
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a device for optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera.
* The device uses means for deviating and suppressing the beam to scan successively and cyclically over N lines of a picture plane.
* By adjusting the counting capacity of a programmable counter, the device can achieve a higher picture sequence frequency.
* The device allows for high and selectable resolution in time for recording rapidly changing phenomena. 
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention integrates voice calls with multimedia sessions as blended calls.
• A multimedia server with blender software manages blended calls, using both voice and multimedia components.
• Incoming calls are directed to the blender if the recipient supports blended services.
• Outgoing calls are also processed through the blender if the caller supports blended services.
• SIP is used for call setup and signaling paths are controlled by the blender.
• The blender separates call and multimedia requests, passing them to the appropriate devices.
• The multimedia server handles call disposition and manages the call components.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to a content synchronization framework for connected devices using dynamic attributes and file bundles.
• The framework involves a central reference point server processing synchronization requests, constructing response bundles, and prioritizing file downloads based on client context.
• Clients create a delta list of files to download, retrieve files in the specified order, and reject incomplete bundles.
• The framework supports multiple languages, file compression, and resumption of synchronization from the point of failure.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention provides a system for communication between finders and owners of lost objects.
* Owners are provided with tags containing unique IDs and virtual locales.
* Owners register their contact information and tag IDs on a centralized database.
* Finders access a website using the tag information to communicate with owners.
* Finders can send messages to owners anonymously through the system.
* The system allows for secure and timely communication between finders and owners of lost objects.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention is an electron multiplier using thin foils to create secondary electrons.
• The foils are arranged in a series of stages within an evacuated enclosure.
• An electric field accelerates electrons through the foils to generate an electron avalanche.
• The gain of the multiplier is maximized by optimizing foil thickness and material.
• The foil electron multiplier design eliminates ion feedback issues present in continuous multipliers.
• Commercially available carbon foils are preferred for their thinness and uniformity.
• A supporting grid may be required for thin foils to provide structural integrity.
• The gain efficiency of the foil electron multiplier is higher than conventional multipliers.
• The foil electron multiplier can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors.
• The design allows for position-sensitive information and has advantages over other types of electron multipliers.
</summary>

<summary>
• The 3-D Phenomenoscope is a system that allows motion pictures to be viewed in 3D effortlessly.
• The system uses a digital sensor, computer processor, and lens control algorithm to synchronize the lenses of viewer glasses.
• Different lens states are used based on the direction of lateral motion detected in the motion picture.
• The system can detect lateral motion using an intensity edge finding algorithm.
• The lenses can be set to clear-clear, clear-dark, or dark-clear based on the detected motion.
• The algorithm tracks vertical intensity edges in successive frames to determine motion direction.
• The system can adjust for head movement to ensure accurate synchronization.
• The system can be used with any type of motion picture media and viewing device.
• The goal is to provide a 3D viewing experience without the need for special equipment or alterations to the motion picture.
</summary>

<summary>
* Method and apparatus for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die without a wafer saw.
* Process involves forming trenches along scribe lines, applying pressure to break wafer, and singulating individual die.
* Optional steps include back-grinding wafer thickness and using adhesive tape for support during singulation.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a field emission display device with a protection structure to prevent damage to field emission elements.
* Field emission display devices have advantages over LCDs, such as higher contrast ratio and lower power consumption.
* The protection structure includes reduction plates or electrodes to deflect ionized gases away from the cathode.
* The reduction plates can be arranged in parallel rows or in a meshwork pattern among the field emission elements.
* The reduction plates are negatively charged to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions and prevent electrical surges.
* The protection structure prolongs the lifetime of the field emission elements in the device.
</summary>

<summary>
* Image sensor with multiple imaging planes
* Overcomes limitations of prior art CCD sensors
* Allows recording of information through edge surface
* Semiconductor substrate with P-type material
* Image sensor elements on top surface and edge surfaces
* Charge carriers guided towards CCDs by P+ layers
* Improved charge collection and reduced crosstalk
* Suitable for various applications including color imaging
* Mounting arrangement for image sensor with opaque coating on edges
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to home networks with power management systems.
* Power management is important to reduce energy consumption in home networks.
* Methods are provided for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device.
* The network master node can enter a power management mode while transferring functions to a slave node.
* Selection criteria are used to determine which slave node will become the new master node.
* The network slave node accepts the transfer of administrative functions and becomes the new master node.
* Devices on the network can self-promote to become the master node if no master node is present.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to arrangements of antenna elements to measure the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation.
• An antenna array for operation by radio interferometric techniques comprises at least four antennae spaced to provide equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane.
• The array can be used for unambiguous angle measurements, with values for d and h optimized for specific elevation angles to maximize measurement accuracy and resolution.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a seal supported subminiature lamp assembly utilizing a high temperature polymer to provide a liquid tight seal, eliminating the need for adhesive and improving resistance to degradation.
* The assembly includes a polymeric seal support surrounding the glass envelope and base, with the addition of potting material to minimize air volume and prevent penetration of harmful substances, providing extended axial length sealing, heat resistance, ease of handling, and increased resistance to invasion and chemical attack.
</summary>

<summary>
• The present invention relates to precoder configuration in MIMO systems.
• The GDFE Precoder provides an optimal capacity solution for MU-MIMO wireless systems.
• Various precoding techniques such as Block Diagonalization and Tomlinson-Harashima Precoding have been proposed in the literature.
• The proposed method for GDFE Precoder significantly reduces computational cost without loss of capacity.
• The method involves computing filter matrices C, transmit filter matrix B, feedforward filter matrix F, and interference pre-cancellation matrix G.
• Numerical examples demonstrate the computation of these matrices for different scenarios in MU-MIMO systems.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and housing for an axial fan with increased intake airflow rate.
• A conventional fan typically includes a fan housing and impeller to dissipate heat generated by electrical elements.
• The design of the fan housing restricts the airflow rate and efficiency of heat dissipation.
• The invention aims to enhance heat dissipation by enlarging the intake airflow area without modifying assembly conditions.
• The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams from an opening to another opening.
• The sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to increase intake or discharge area for air streams.
• The design allows for the impeller's blade dimension to increase, improving airflow rate and heat dissipation efficiency.
• Various modifications to the housing design, such as inclined portions and notches, further enhance airflow and reduce noise.
• The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink to dissipate heat generated by electrical elements like a CPU.
• The design of the housing and impeller improves heat dissipation efficiency and can be applied in various systems and configurations.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention is an electroluminescent display panel that can display images in different colors without using an intermediate electrode.
* The panel consists of layers laminated on a glass substrate, with a first luminescent layer emitting green light and a second luminescent layer emitting orange light, allowing for color changes by adjusting the driving voltage.
</summary>

<summary>
• The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, a system for Internet telephony, and a method for the same.
• The communications terminal includes audio means, converting means, protocol means, and wireless communications means for wireless near field communication with a connecting unit to establish a connection to a network and/or the Internet.
</summary>

<summary>
* The invention relates to a method for fabricating a structure for semiconductor circuitry.
* The method involves growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on a semiconductor substrate.
* A Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide is then deposited on the buffer layer.
* A germanium layer is epitaxially grown on the semiconductor substrate before the buffer layer is added.
* The non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer is less than about 10 nm thick.
* A second non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide layer can be added on top of the Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide.
